arts.ttl: A clear sign that Wolves have an incredible chance of getting a result vs Bournemouth
arts.sum: Wolves have the chance to pick up their first points of the Premier League season when they take on Bournemouth this weekend and a streak that they are on points to this being a great opportunity. Wolves have never lost away to Bournemouth in the Premier League

arts.ttl: Wolves XI vs Bournemouth – Predicted lineup and team news
arts.sum: Wolves travel to the south coast to face AFC Bournemouth on Saturday under early-season pressure. A demoralising 4-0 defeat to Manchester City on the opening day extended the club’s winless league run to five games. Manager Vitor Pereira will be demanding a huge response from his players in what is already a vital match. arts.ttl: Bournemouth vs Wolves – Match preview and team news
arts.sum: AFC Bournemouth and Wolverhampton Wanderers are both eager to secure their first points of the season when they meet at the Vitality Stadium on Saturday. Bournemouth enter the match in 16th place, while Wolves are languishing in 20th after heavy opening-day defeats. arts.sum: Bournemouth play their first home game of the 2025/26 season on Saturday, welcoming a Wolves side also in search of their first points. Despite an opening-day defeat, Andoni Iraola’s side will be full of confidence after a courageous performance against champions Liverpool. arts.ttl: Andoni Iraola is upbeat about Wolves’ prospects despite defeat on opening matchday
arts.sum: I think they have good, physical defenders, even the games we played against them here: we had one of the red card, and the other one, it was difficult to score against them.” It’s normal: first game of the season the four defenders first time they play together so things we need to improve like I suppose every team now in in this moment but overall it was a very good game from our side.”

arts.ttl: Pre-Match Analysis: AFC Bournemouth return home to face Wolves
arts.sum: Since returning from Anfield, Ben Gannon Doak and Amine Adli have been added to the squad, bringing strong and exciting attacking depth for the bench. Looking towards this weekend’s fixtures, the Cherries return home for the first time this season, facing Wolverhampton Wanderers at the Vitality Stadium.

arts.ttl: Andoni Iraola names the Wolves player he’s been impressed with ahead of Bournemouth clash
arts.sum: Wolves travel to Bournemouth this weekend for their second game of the Premier League season, and manager Andoni Iraola has revealed which player he sees as a threat. Jorgen Strand Larsen is the Wolves player Andoni Iraola sees as a threat

arts.ttl: Peter Crouch and Steve Sidwell agree on what will happen when Wolves play Bournemouth
arts.sum: This is likely why both Peter Crouch and Steve Sidwell have predicted Wolves will lose on their trip to the Vitality Stadium. Both Peter Crouch and Steve Sidwell will be familiar with this importance, and they have had their say ahead of Saturday’s clash against Bournemouth.
